criterion: Reward for accurately documenting all patient-reported information about sertraline (mood somewhat better, unsure if due to medication, nausea only in first few days, inconsistent intake with food, skipped a refill due to cost)

Reward for faithfully capturing clinician assessments and instructions (normalizing early nausea, suggestion to take with food, phone reminder for consistency, offer to explore assistance programs to reduce cost)

Reward for correctly incorporating pertinent chart details actually relevant to the encounter (active sertraline 50 mg, diagnoses of major depressive disorder and/or anxiety) while omitting unrelated chart data
Reward for overall completeness: note covers every clinically relevant statement or action mentioned in the transcript without omission or distortion
Penalize for omitting any key fact from the transcript (e.g., skipped refill, nausea timing, reminder suggestion, affordability discussion)
Penalize for adding information not present or implied in the transcript or chart (new symptoms, different dosages, lab orders, follow-ups, etc.)

Penalize for incorrect or indiscriminate copying from the chart, such as including irrelevant family history or past conditions that were not brought up, or misstating current medication details (strength, frequency)
